trans-unit.source: Preparing a Computer for Manual Driver Deployment
trans-unit.target: Preparing a Computer for Manual Driver Deployment

trans-unit.source: You can deploy a driver automatically or manually.
trans-unit.target: You can deploy a driver automatically or manually.

trans-unit.source: In either case, you need to prepare the target computer first.
trans-unit.target: In either case, you need to prepare the target computer first.

trans-unit.source: Here we describe how to prepare the target computer if you choose to deploy your driver manually.
trans-unit.target: Here we describe how to prepare the target computer if you choose to deploy your driver manually.

trans-unit.source: Typically the computer where you install and test a driver is separate from the computer where you develop and build the driver package.
trans-unit.target: Typically the computer where you install and test a driver is separate from the computer where you develop and build the driver package.

trans-unit.source: The computer where you build the driver is called the *host computer*, and the computer where you install and test the driver is called the *target computer* or the *test computer*.
trans-unit.target: The computer where you build the driver is called the *host computer*, and the computer where you install and test the driver is called the *target computer* or the *test computer*.

trans-unit.source: The process of moving the driver package to the target computer and installing the driver it is called *deploying the driver*.
trans-unit.target: The process of moving the driver package to the target computer and installing the driver it is called *deploying the driver*.

trans-unit.source: On the target computer, open a Command Prompt window as Administrator.
trans-unit.target: On the target computer, open a Command Prompt window as Administrator.

trans-unit.source: Enter **bcdedit /set TESTSIGNING ON**.
trans-unit.target: Enter **bcdedit /set TESTSIGNING ON**.

trans-unit.source: Reboot the target computer.
trans-unit.target: Reboot the target computer.

trans-unit.source: Copy the [DevCon](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/Library/Windows/Hardware/Ff544707) tool to a folder on the target computer (for example, c:\\Tools).
trans-unit.target: Copy the [DevCon](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/Library/Windows/Hardware/Ff544707) tool to a folder on the target computer (for example, c:\\Tools).

trans-unit.source: The DevCon tool is included in the Windows Driver Kit (WDK).
trans-unit.target: The DevCon tool is included in the Windows Driver Kit (WDK).

trans-unit.source: You can find it under the Tools directory (for example, C:\\Program Files (x86)\\Windows Kits\\8.1\\Tools\\x64\\devcon.exe).
trans-unit.target: You can find it under the Tools directory (for example, C:\\Program Files (x86)\\Windows Kits\\8.1\\Tools\\x64\\devcon.exe).

trans-unit.source: Create or get a certificate file that you can install on the target computer.
trans-unit.target: Create or get a certificate file that you can install on the target computer.

trans-unit.source: For example, suppose you have used Microsoft Visual Studio to build the RAMDisk Storage Driver sample in the [code gallery](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=618052).
trans-unit.target: For example, suppose you have used Microsoft Visual Studio to build the RAMDisk Storage Driver sample in the [code gallery](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=618052).

trans-unit.source: The build process creates a certificate (.cer) file.
trans-unit.target: The build process creates a certificate (.cer) file.

trans-unit.source: The location of the certificate file varies depending on what you have specified for configuration and platform.
trans-unit.target: The location of the certificate file varies depending on what you have specified for configuration and platform.

trans-unit.source: For the RAMDisk sample, if your configuration is Win7 Debug and your platform is x64, then the certificate file, xx.cer, is in your solution folder under C++\\x64\\Win7Debug.
trans-unit.target: For the RAMDisk sample, if your configuration is Win7 Debug and your platform is x64, then the certificate file, xx.cer, is in your solution folder under C++\\x64\\Win7Debug.

trans-unit.source: Copy the certificate file to a folder on your target computer (for example c:\\Certificates).
trans-unit.target: Copy the certificate file to a folder on your target computer (for example c:\\Certificates).

trans-unit.source: On the target computer, right click the certificate file, and choose **Install**.
trans-unit.target: On the target computer, right click the certificate file, and choose **Install**.

trans-unit.source: Work through the installation wizard.
trans-unit.target: Work through the installation wizard.

trans-unit.source: When you build one of the WDK gallery samples, the build process creates a test-signing certificate.
trans-unit.target: When you build one of the WDK gallery samples, the build process creates a test-signing certificate.

trans-unit.source: You need to install a test-signing certificate only once.
trans-unit.target: You need to install a test-signing certificate only once.

trans-unit.source: If you have installed a certificate from a WDK gallery sample, you can install other gallery samples without installing a certificate again.
trans-unit.target: If you have installed a certificate from a WDK gallery sample, you can install other gallery samples without installing a certificate again.
